items.sentence: Tom leaned on Mary\'s shoulder for support.
Tom and Mary must have something in common.
Tom and Mary ran into the air-raid shelter.
Tom and Mary reminisced about the old days.
Tom couldn\'t see Mary from where he stood.
Tom couldn\'t stop himself from doing that.
Tom couldn\'t tell Mary everything he knew.
Tom couldn\'t tell Mary how he really felt.
Tom couldn\'t touch the bottom of the pool.
I left Australia to avoid getting arrested.
I like to play music written by my friends.
I met Tom on my way to school this morning.
I might be able to convince Tom to do that.
I narrowly escaped being run over by a car.
I need to be sure that you understand this.
I need to find out where Tom was yesterday.
I need to go to the store to buy some eggs.
I need to tell Tom Mary is in the hospital.
I need you to go to the supermarket for me.
I never actually saw Tom and John fighting.
Tom doesn\'t snore as loudly as he used to.
Please don\'t tell Tom about what happened.
I came because I thought you might be here.
Tom said he didn\'t know anybody in Boston.
Tom said he wasn\'t in the mood to do that.
Tom said he\'d prefer not to do that today.
Do you really expect me to let that happen?
Do you really think I want to do what I do?
Tom knew Mary couldn\'t do that by herself.
Do you think it could\'ve been done better?
There\'s really no need for you to do that.
Tom says he has a lot of friends in Boston.
I\'ve just talked to Tom about that matter.
I eat a boiled egg for breakfast every day.
I have been studying French four years now.
It seems those two are made for each other.
I wish we had sung that new song you wrote.
I wonder how many Canadians live in Boston.
I wonder if Tom really intended to do that.
I think Tom is at least partially to blame.
I think Tom is just trying to be practical.
I think Tom is trying to tell us something.
I think Tom might feel the same way you do.
I think Tom might finally have a good idea.
I wonder why Tom ever wanted to marry Mary.
I wonder why Tom thought we should do that.
I wonder why Tom wants to buy one of those.
It\'s time to take the pie out of the oven.
It\'s unlikely Tom is as busy as you think.
I always listen to anything Tom has to say.
